section.title: About &MiKTeX;
section.para:
&MiKTeX; (pronounced mik-tech) is an up-to-date implementation of
MiKTeX how to pronounce
&TeX; and related programs for &Windows; (all current variants). &TeX; is a typesetting system invented by D. E. Knuth.
Knuth Donald E.

listitem.para: integrated package management: missing packages can be installed automatically (on-the-fly) during run-time
network friendly: &MiKTeX; can be run directly from a shared and read-only network directory
enhanced previewer capabilities: forward/inverse &DVI; search, graphics, color, magnifying glass, …
open source: &MiKTeX; source code is get-at-able for everyone

section.para: The &MiKTeX; distribution consists of the following components:

listitem.para: a &METAFONT; derivative for the creation of &PostScript; figures
assists in keeping the &MiKTeX; system up-to-date
tools for the creation of bibliographies & indexes, PostScript utilities, and more
